name: Taiiku Okazaki
description: {{Nihongo|'''Akitoshi Oka'''|岡 亮聡|Oka Akitoshi|born July 3, 1989}}, known professionally by the stage name {{Nihongo|'''Taiiku Okazaki'''|岡崎 体育|Okazaki Taiiku}}, is a Japanese musician and songwriter who is signed to [[Sony Music Entertainment Japan|SME Records]]. Beginning his career as an independent musician in 2012, he made his major debut with the release of his first major album ''Basin Techno'' in 2016. The album includes the song "Music Video", which became a [[Viral video|viral hit]] in Japan for parodying common tropes used in music videos. That same year, he performed the song "Pose", which was used as the first closing theme for the anime series ''[[List of Pokémon: Sun & Moon episodes|Pokémon: Sun & Moon]]''. He has also written music for commercials and for other musicians.
